    <span id="ctl00_MainContent_DetailedOutput"><h1 class="title">Pixie</h1>Insatiably curious, overly excitable, and just a bit puckish, pixies are wanderers and tricksters who use their pixie dust to create all sorts of whimsical situations, as well as to defend themselves. Other creatures often have trouble understanding a pixie’s rapid, rambling way of speaking.<br /><br /><b><u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5&General=true">Recall Knowledge - Fey</a></u> (<u><a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10">Nature</a></u>)</b>: DC 19<h1 class="title"><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=391">Pixie</a><span style="float:right;">Creature 4</span></h1><a target="_blank" href="Images\Monsters\Sprite_Pixie.png"><img class="thumbnail" src="Images\Monsters\Sprite_Pixie.png"></a><span alt="Chaotic Neutral" class="traitalignment" title="Chaotic Neutral">CN</span><span alt="Small" class="traitsize" title="Small">Small</span><span alt="Fey Trait" class="trait" title="Creatures of the First World are called the fey."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=69">Fey</a></span><span alt="Sprite Trait" class="trait" title="A family of diminutive winged fey with a strong connection to primal magic."><a href="Traits.aspx?ID=238">Sprite</a></span><br /><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 309</i></a><br /><b>Perception</b> +12; low-light vision<br /><b>Languages</b> <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=1"><u>Common</a></u>, <a href="Languages.aspx?ID=10"><u>Sylvan</a></u><br /><b>Skills</b> <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=1"><u>Acrobatics</a></u> +13, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=5"><u>Deception</a></u> +11, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=10"><u>Nature</a></u> +10, <a href="Skills.aspx?ID=15"><u>Stealth</a></u> +11<br /><b>Str</b> -1, <b>Dex</b> +5, <b>Con</b> +1, <b>Int</b> +3, <b>Wis</b> +2, <b>Cha</b> +3<br /><b>Items</b> <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=76"><u>longbow (60 arrows)</u></a>, <a href="Weapons.aspx?ID=43"><u>shortsword</u></a><hr /><b>AC</b> 23, <b>Fort</b> +8, <b>Ref</b> +14, <b>Will</b> +12; +1 status to all saves vs. magic<br /><b>HP</b> 40; <b>Weaknesses</b> cold iron 5<hr /><b>Speed</b> 15 feet, fly 45 feet<br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Melee</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> shartsword +13 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=170"><u>agile</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=179"><u>finesse</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=200"><u>versatile S</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d6+4 piercing</span><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Ranged</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png"> longbow +13 (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=174"><u>deadly 1d10</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=103"><u>magical</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=248"><u>range increment 100 feet</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=254"><u>reload 0</a></u>, <a href="Traits.aspx?ID=201"><u>volley 20 feet</a></u>), <b>Damage</b> 1d8+4 piercing</span><b>Primal Innate Spells</b> DC 21; <b>4th</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=164">invisibility</a></u></i> (at will; self only); <b>3rd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=78">dispel magic</a></u></i>; <b>2nd</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=103">entangle</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=107">faerie fire</a></u></i>; <b>1st</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=159">illusory disguise</a></u></i>; <b>Cantrips</b> <b>(2nd)</b> <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=58">dancing lights</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=66">detect magic</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=132">ghost sound</a></u></i>, <i><u><a href="Spells.aspx?ID=280">shield</a></u></i><br /><span class="hanging-indent"><b>Sprinkle Pixie Dust</b> <img class="actiondark" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction.png"><img class="actionlight" alt="Single Action" style="height:15px; padding:0px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Actions\OneAction_I.png">  (<a href="Traits.aspx?ID=104"><u>manipulate</a></u>) The pixie sprinkles pixie dust onto one of its arrows. If the pixie hits a creature with that arrow before the pixie’s next turn, the arrow inflicts one of the following special effects instead of dealing damage. Each effect depends on the target’s DC 21 Will save. On a critical hit, the target treats its save result as one degree worse.<br><ul><li><b>Charm</b> (emotion, enchantment, incapacitation, mental) The target suffers the effects of a <i><SPELLS%34%%>charm</a></i> spell, except it doesn’t gain a bonus to its save if the only hostile act was the pixie firing its bow, and the pixie can choose to direct the target’s adoration toward another creature rather than itself.</li><li><b>Memory Loss</b> (divination, mental) On a failed Will save, the target loses the last 5 minutes of its memory.</li><li><b>Sleep</b> (enchantment, incapacitation, mental, sleep) The target suffers the effects of a 3rd-level <i><SPELLS%288%%>sleep</a></i> spell.</li><li><b>Subdual</b> (enchantment, mental, nonlethal) The target takes 4d6 mental damage, depending on its basic Will save.</li></ul></span><h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" title="Sidebar - Advice and Rules" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_1_AdviceAndRules.png"> Variant Pixie Arrows</h3>Pixies can enchant their arrows with a wide variety of effects, though nearly all such enchantments are designed to charm or bewilder, never maim. Some arrows may emulate the effects of spells such as confusion, fear, hideous laughter, and even suggestion.<h2 class="title">All Monsters in "<a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=95">Sprite</a>"</h2><table class="inner"><tr><td><b>Name</b></td><td><b>Level</b></td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=390">Grig</a></td><td>1</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=391">Pixie</a></td><td>4</td></tr><tr><td><a href="Monsters.aspx?ID=389">Sprite</a></td><td>-1</td></tr></table><h1 class="title"><a href="MonsterFamilies.aspx?ID=95">Sprite</a></h1><b>Source</b> <a href="https://paizo.com/products/btq01y0m?Pathfinder-Bestiary" target="_blank" class="external-link"><i>Bestiary pg. 308</i></a><br />Elusive, flighty, and ebullient, sprites are what many villagers first imagine when they hear the terms “fey” or “fairy.” While their dispositions vary from the benevolent grig to the trickster pixie, all sprites share a connection to magic and diminutive size. This family of fey shares its name with its slightest and most populous member, the common sprite.<h3 class="title"><img alt="Sidebar - Additional Lore" title="Sidebar - Additional Lore" style="height:20px; padding:2px 2px 0px 2px" src="Images\Icons\Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png"> Sprite Pranks</h3>Sprite pranks tend to be kind‑hearted in nature; they might use their abilities to embarrass a braggart or to trick them into a convoluted scheme to help someone notice an admirer who has been there for them all along. Their plans are often half-baked; sprites’ mercurial nature means they can easily become distracted by something new before following through on a previous plan.</span>

    <br />

      var initializeExpand = function (toggle) {
          var targetAttrString = "[data-target='" + toggle.dataset.toggle + "']";
          //target = menu to be collapsed
          var target = document.querySelector(targetAttrString);

                  //hide other in group if exists
                  if (target.dataset.group) {
                      var otherExpanded = document.querySelector('.expanded[data-group="' + target.dataset.group + '"]');
                      if (otherExpanded) {
                          otherExpanded.classList.remove('expanded');
                      }
                  }
                  target.classList.add('expanded');
              } else {
                  target.classList.remove('expanded');
              }
          });
      };
      (function () {
          //toggles = link that expands/collapses target
          var toggles = document.querySelectorAll('[data-toggle]');
          toggles.forEach(function (toggle) {
              initializeExpand(toggle);
          });
          //searches
          var searches = document.querySelectorAll('.search');
          searches.forEach(function (search) {
              initializeSearch(search);
          });
      })();
  </script>
</body>
</html>
